Economics (Microeconomics).subject: Economics (Microeconomics)
Economics (Microeconomics).question: Demand for a commodity refers to
options: Quantity demanded at certain price during any particular period of time
Economics (Microeconomics).answer: Quantity demanded at certain price during any particular period of time
Economics (Microeconomics).explanation: The demand for a commodity at a given price is the quantity that will be purchased at a unit of time and at a unit price. Demand has the following features; Demand refers to the quantity at a given price, Demand must be defined per unit time.

Economics (Microeconomics).subject: Economics (Microeconomics)
Economics (Microeconomics).question: An exceptional demand curve is one that slopes
Economics (Microeconomics).explanation: An exceptional demand curve is one that slopes upward to the right

Economics (Monetary System).subject: Economics (Monetary System)
Economics (Monetary System).question: Rise in the price of a commodity means
options: rise in the value of currency only
fall in the value of currency only
rise in the value of commodity only
fall in the value of currency and rise in the value of commodity.
Economics (Monetary System).answer: fall in the value of currency only
Economics (Monetary System).explanation: Rise in the price of a commodity means both fall in the value of currency and rise in the value of commodity.
